I was wondering when someone would suggest an IRC server we could connect to ...
I was in the clique, I think, and I never had to fill out an application. Musta been special.
I saw a VH1 special the other, well, year -- "Ten Years of Grunge" or some such. Weird to see high school memories in documentary form.
From what I understand, you can have alcohol at the Metroparks if you have a permit. I don't know how that works, but they probably like it if you hire one of the more private buildings. They have those scattered around -- there's one near Squire's Castle, too.
Michaele: I was in Bradford, a town best known for its recurrent riots between the Pakistani community and the police. But, for people in the peace field, it's also well known for the Department. Go figure.
Most people I've spoken to, and Bradford is very international, can differentiate between Americans and the government and are nice to you while they trash the latter -- if you give them space. It seems people need about five minutes of venting where they trot out the "All Americans ___" statements, but if you present a nuanced, well-thought-out response, you can get into a really good conversation with most people. If, as one of my American friends always did, you shoot back with, "Well, where you come from ___," you will get into fights and it will appear that the whole world hates you. 

Ned / Mike / Highlandr / and (if I remember) bk347
